text.text_translated: Gerlinde climbed Everest. So she decided to climb all 14 very high mountains. These mountains are 8,000 metres tall. She climbs without oxygen to make it harder. This is dangerous. There is little oxygen at the top of high mountains. Little oxygen can make her brain and body not work well. Gerlinde is a famous climber. She uses her fame to help a charity. This charity helps poor children and orphans in Nepal.

feedback.feedback: PASS: The text successfully meets all A2 CEFR readability standards while preserving factual integrity and meaning. The MeaningBERT score of 0.8058 and BERTScore of 0.9384 confirm excellent fidelity to the original content. The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2. Vocabulary is appropriately simplified (e.g., 'risky' to 'dangerous', 'functioning' to 'not work well', 'increase the challenge' to 'make it harder'). Sentence structures are consistently short and simple, using A2-level connectors like 'So'. No B1 or higher vocabulary or complex grammatical structures were detected.
